main event: A disk-shaped object, approximately 20-25 feet in diameter, was observed by ground-based radar on July 9, 1960 in Mason, Ohio.
interesting points: The object was bright white in color and hovered for a short time (4-5 seconds) before moving at high speed to the south.
Astro charts indicated that the object's position and movement were not consistent with astronomical observations.
The sources did not investigate the sighting further.
The observer could not describe the object exactly, stating that it appeared as a bright light that was moving up and down and could not be identified.
The sighting lasted for about 30 minutes.
sighted object: a bright white disk-shaped object, approximately 20-25 feet in diameter
